result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle D Puig was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Polk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Subject to good time and work release.

Must report to Probation today (6/28/2017). Probation may petition court for early discharge from Probation if deem necessary. Probation may be tranferred to Dunn County without further order of the Court.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay will be tax intercept, suspension and/or civil judgment.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay will be tax intercept, suspension and/or civil judgment.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
Eligible for expungment upon successful completion of Probation.  Must petition court.
Must complete an AODA assessment and comply with recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
